lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, a show where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors play Dungeons and Dragons. So sorry for the tech delay. We had a few technical errors, but we've pushed through them. Let's go ahead and get this show on the road. First, with your announcements.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: Sure you guys heard Hector yelling at you in that nice little ad that we had, and the last announcement that I have is that we will be a sub-only chat tonight. This is not something that... we tried holding off as long we possibly could, but we've had a lot of requests from people to try it. So we're going to try it out tonight, see how it goes; if it goes well, we might end up staying with it. But we really didn't want to, because we wanted to keep this as open as possible. But we've been getting a lot of requests to, so we're going to give it a shot and see how that goes, and just wanted to let you guys know that was up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: All I got!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How's the weather in New York?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, you know, it's just really cold and rainy, but it's good. It's good. I've missed you guys so bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We missed you, Ashley.

lines.name: MARISHA, LIAM
lines.text: We missed you, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: So much! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or fails at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or fails at it; we'll see.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: He told me five minutes ago, and he told me what was going on, and I was like, "I'm back, "can I play?" He said, "Yeah you can play. Let me plan real quick."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. So. Appreciate your understanding of the delay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you can survive the Extra Life game...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that's true. Maintaining a narrative, that's the hard part.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never can forget.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's true.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never forget. The Deck of Many Things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Had good feedback on it so far?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Go listen to it. It's like what Laura said last week; it's like weird because it's kind of like a vulnerable soft spot, but yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Journey songs. Go check them out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Goodness.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where do they go to do that? At the Geek and Sundry website?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Geek and Sundry website.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Or you can, if you follow Geek and Sundry on Spotify, you can find all of our Spotify playlists on there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right. But you should go to Geek and Sundry's website because we each wrote little descriptions.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Thanks, Taliesin.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm here to ruin everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And we've had people spoil themselves.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, you should read our notes. We have liner notes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we also each picked out some of our favorite fan arts that we've gotten.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we picked those ones out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis is abandoning us; he had to go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's done; he's out. Travis is creating his playlist right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Travis is like, "No!" We lost a Grog, gained an Ashley. I'm okay with that. All right, cool, so next up, Wyrmwood has their Critical Role stuff for you guys who want to buy really awesome, nice and pricey upper-tier geek stuff.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not all pretty expensive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And it's Christmas coming up, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a wide spectrum. Their website is Wyrmwood Gaming, and the code that will get you free shipping on an order is CritRole. CritRole, all one word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. Couple other things. Also, we tonight are putting-- we don't have Pike's because that was a kind of surprise, but we have new art by our official artist Kit Buss for all the character portraits we'll be using tonight.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're really good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're up? They're below us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So you can see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm so excited! I'm looking down at it right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you so much Kit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have sideburns!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We look hot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pink and proud.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm a little scruffy. I've seen some shit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Grog has a beard. Look at Grog and his beard over there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog looks good with a beard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's over there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's down and to our left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, they have it in order as to what we're sitting.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really? I can't see it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well it's not there, either.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's underneath the tables.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, right. That's Ashley. What am I doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All screens have our show on them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I've been told that goes up tomorrow. So, those of you who are, "Where has the episode?" It'll be up there tomorrow for you to watch. And you get to see all the amazing things that a bunch of fans made and sent out and all the lovey-dovey awesome connection stuff that we stayed here until midnight last week having fun with, so check it out tomorrow. It's a lot of fun. All right, also, let's see, reminder we have awesome t-shirts online like the one that Travis is wearing-- it's been one of those days-- Taliesin is also wearing it. And the newer one that Laura is wearing. Those are available. We also have the keychains and the necklaces, too, so those are cool; those are up. Games that came out this week? Fallout 4 came out this week, as I'm sure many of you are aware.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we've all been playing it. Foaming at mouth!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Who's in it? Matt, you're in it. Is it just Matt? Is that it? Who else is in it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, who else is in it? Anyone else?

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA, SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not in it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just Matt?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you in it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did enough voices for Fallout: New Vegas.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I was all over New Vegas, as well, so they cut me out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We recently found you, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, in the game.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, Matt was like, "Do I really?" And I was getting it from two fronts. I'm like, "God damn it."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm a straight-up hoarder in Fallout.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a hoarder. I need more toy cars. I don't have enough screws!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I need screws!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Screws are fucking hard to come by.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Because that's the only way you can upgrade your guns!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shushing noises)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: ZAC
lines.text: I don't have to do this on this show almost ever, but let's go, guys. Come on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So anyway, I play McCreedy and Z-114.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: BlizzCon, oh yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh yeah, I'm getting there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, you're getting there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Also, a bunch of us went to BlizzCon this past weekend, which had a lot of fun, fun panels and stuff, and we met a whole bunch of Critters that were there as well.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So many Critters.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was really cool. We had kind of an impromptu signing for a while, and we had a bunch of very positive conversations with a bunch of you cool people, so those who came out and said hello: hello! It was great meeting you all.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks for seeing us.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nice to see you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We had a good time. It was fun, and Liam was all over BlizzCon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I was prom queen at BlizzCon this year.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) It was pretty rad. All right, couple last things. Oh, today, a few of us went with other fantastic hosts on our Twitch channel network to the Children's Hospital of Los Angeles and handed over our donation from the Extra Life charity we've been doing for the past month or so that you guys made happen. It was incredible to see the outreach everyone put into it, and we ended up handing over pretty much $115,000 dollars to the Children's Hospital of Los Angeles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Congratulations, you guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a wonderful facility.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And the hospital was amazing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a good hospital.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it's such a great tour. They have so many creative things that I've never seen in hospitals-- I got kids-- or would've thought they had a room for teenagers; it was cool and had teenage stuff in it. It was awesome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh yeah; they have a giveaway library, where they give a book to a kid every day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With little toadstools.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give out 32,000 books a year.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not lend, give books to kids.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a lot!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're actually going to be talking about that later, but they apparently have a book wishlist, so we're going to be getting that from them and sharing it to you guys because these people need books.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, what the heck? How much money? (laughter)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And last but not least, we have an announcement, do you guys want to handle this one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh god. Yeah! I forgot about that!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, high five! We're high-fiving and no one knows about what we're high-fiving over. So we have a fun new announcement for everybody. Aren't you excited?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm ready to announce it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're so ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so, Critical Role is finally getting a weekly comic strip.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm famous!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've made it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I did it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're getting a comic, you guys. It's starting off as a comic strip. So it is going to be coming--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: In newspapers everywhere?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In newspapers everywhere online if the website is named GeekandSundry.com. So, everywhere. Yes, and so it's going to be starting next Wednesday. They're going to be releasing weekly on Wednesdays.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've got work to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know; it's crazy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The first run that we're going to do-- they're going to be semi-episodic, I guess, like loose story line little vignettes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like a comic strip. Like a Doonesbury, so you get little segments that all lead up into a larger thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're going to be switching out artists as we go through different story arcs, and Wendy's our first one.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's going to be telling the story of our very first winter festival, which is-- should we tell them is also mixed with other events in Critical Role history?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. You'll see

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You'll see. It be fabulous.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Much to come.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Much to come.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But definitely go check that out because--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not yet, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not yet, next week.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's up next week? Holy moly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Next week. The first one goes out on Wednesday. So the more people who go and look at it, the more we may get later.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Go check it out because the more people who check it out, the more likely they are to say, "This deserves to be an entire comic book."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Big dreams, Taliesin, big dreams.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With animation and craziness and hyperlinks and all sorts of things.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we want to make more content for everyone, so if you like the content, then go look at the content that shows that we could possibly do more content.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We enjoy doing this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes. We want to see how far this ship will sail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah. I think that's all our announcements.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's so good to have you here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, I'm so glad you could be here, Ashley.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh yeah, I wish were there in person.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Have you got your dice and your character sheets ready?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got your gear, Johnson?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You ready?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I got all my gear. I'm so nervous and so excited. I feel like I don't know how to play anymore!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like falling off a bicycle; it's easy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, with that, let's go ahead and kick back into the mood of the current venture into Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Make the beat drop.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the sun has now set over the horizon, the rain beginning to pour heavily into the center of the town. There was efforts meant to keep the army at bay as you all rushed towards the west to escape the immediate fray, and that was where we left off last session.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We fucking run.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we still running? Are we still running away?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We just got to the tree line, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys haven't gotten to the tree line yet, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Jesus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are still running.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're heading out of town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There's a shit-load of skeletons behind us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are they right behind us? I'm still riding Trinket?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this time, you are on Trinket. The rest of you are running through the muddy streets. Your feet are slick against the ground, and you have to catch yourself every now and then from not tumbling forward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dust of Tracelessness?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are the skeletons still behind us? Can we see them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you glance over, they're just now starting to pour from the town square itself, and it was hard to see the exact number, but from your perspective in the darkened kind of just post-sunset light, you didn't see the end of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whoa, triple digits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are now looking behind and seeing this undead horde pouring into the central road that you're traveling along, you hear a voice ring out from the other direction, toward where you guys are running. For a second, it's hard to make out what it is, but the voice is suddenly readily familiar; it says, "There! Run! Aid them!" And as you guys glance away from the army and back towards the path where you were traveling, you see what looks to be about ten armed villagers, various pieces of armor, some nicer than others, some have seen some use over time, but nevertheless serviceable and functional. You see at the front of them, Brother Yennan. Sorry, Keeper Yennan is at the front of them armored up, shield at his side, holding aloft the holy symbol of Erathis in his hand, and they're all just running towards you guys (heavy footfalls).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can't leave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I trail behind on Trinket and try to cast Conjure Barrage at the incoming skeletons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd probably have to slow down to do that, because you're a good, like, probably 50, 60 feet away from them, if not a little further. You guys are moving faster than them, so, that even the chase, they're not very quick entities.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So we're 50 or 60 feet away from the skeletons, and how far are we away from the villagers that are coming in the other direction?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're about a hundred feet from you and closing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would advise bringing them with us instead of stopping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But all the villagers that aren't in armor are still in town.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit happens.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm running back. I'm going back towards the skeletons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I was carrying you. You're on Trinket with me, aren't you? Can he carry both of us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, I was pulling her by the arm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I break from Vax's grasp and start running back

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make-- this is technically breaking a grapple.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do want to trail back a little on Trinket and try to cast Conjure Barrage as we're running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're fighting. It would be either acrobatics or athletics versus your athletics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Athletics. Ooh, I rolled an 18.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With that, the slick rain across her forearm (swish) she squeaks her arm out from your grasp, and with that moment, you feel her disappear as she rushes back towards this undead onslaught.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I immediately pivot around and follow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ditto.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I start conjuring up a 4th-level Flaming Sphere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keep in mind you still have Call Lightning coming, so you would be losing the Call Lightning at this time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Flaming Sphere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So with that, the darkened clouds that had gathered begin to slowly disperse as you begin to focus, running forward. As you are charging, using the momentum, the air around you begins to slowly grow and ignite before a ball of flame bursts into your peripheral, and you can control it at will.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, how far away is the horde?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, they're about 30 feet away. Since you went right back towards them as opposed to running away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Am I in front of her?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now, because you gave chase shortly after she ran off, so you guys are about tandem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, here's my question. Are they funneling down one main street? How wide is that street?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 20 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, with my flaming sphere hovering above me, I'm going to throw up a wall of stone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay wait, not before I shoot my Conjure Barrage, because I said I wanted to fucking do it before you did that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Conjure a barrage first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so Conjure Barrage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs) Don't fucking block my arrows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What, what's the distance on Conjure Barrage?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's a 60-foot cone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, then yeah, you can definitely attempt that. Okay. So, as you create this sphere, and it's rolling to your side as you begin to concentrate and look over your shoulder, and you see Trinket (heavy steps) running up, with just mud slung as each one of his claws begins digging into the earth, pulling him forward. (bear roars) On his back, you see Vex pull out an arrow, pull back, and concentrate. The arrow itself seems to split and shatter in her hand, almost like the wood itself divides into five or six different shards. As you release the arrow, it bursts into a funneling cloud of sharp wooden splinters that fires out from the front of you. What's the DC on that spell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It would be 15.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 DC, and is that dex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dexterity, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dexterity. All righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's just got to roll for a hundred skeletons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, no problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The ones that are in range would be about 12 at that point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (scoffs) Only 12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's say you destroyed ten of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I throw up a wall of stone. Am I near the Sun Tree again?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've left the Sun Tree.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Westward across the city, towards the treeline.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And now we're doubling back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're now doubling back. At this point, however, the undead horde has filtered into the town square and is currently between you and the Sun Tree.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so what I'm going to do is, I want to conjure it from underneath me, so as I see them filtering up, I want to pop it up right from underneath me to where I'm on top of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, and the width of it's going to cover the entire street? Okay. (swoosh) The wall of stone lifts you up at its maximum height. What's the maximum height of that spell?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keep that cast hand feeling firm.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The hand went down, the spell went away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten foot by ten foot panels.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, ten feet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right so, (whoosh) you're lifted ten feet up into the air. You can now see, about to crash into the wall, what looks 70 or so skeletons just (crashing noise) scraping into it. You guys can all of a sudden hear through the rainfall in the distance this scratching of metal shields and blades and bones scraping at the stone wall, and (skeletal hissing) hissing and clattering.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I'm going to take the fire sphere, and just start funneling it right down and start cleaning house.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Beyond the wall?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just yeah, right into the thick mess of them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The flaming sphere begins to move over the wall. You've done your action, and you begin to push that forward, because the sphere moving through you would get to about your space. So next turn we'll get to that. You guys have caught up to the wall now. The rest of you have turned around with her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I ran for a few more feet, and then I looked around and no one else was running with me, so I turned around and restarted running back with my little gnome legs. (panting)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN

This one apparently got the drop on them or at least they weren't fully prepared for what they were up against, and it's just swinging this giant club in the air around towards them. Where there would be an eye is just this sunken socket and there are these streaks of dried blood that long before the rainstorm came are just smeared across the face, and part of its jaw is broken open and you can see jagged broken teeth underneath, its tongue lolls out the side and it just (undead groan) reaches up with its club to come on down. (laughs) All right, so the first, it's going to come down and strike you with this giant club-like piece of heavy wood and metal. That's a natural 20.

But you take each blow to the chest, showing off that strength you normally would do to something of your kin and ilk, even though it's not really living, old habits are hard to break. Finishing its turn, three resistance members rush into its side, as it's now turned to face you with its broken leg. Rushing in, strike it. Hits, hits, hits. All have short swords out and they're just stabbing it in the side of its body now that they have this opening and this distraction in the current moment. Five, five, five, which is 21 points of slashing damage.

So as you stand there for a second, you pull your holy symbol up, kind of putting your shield to the side, and as you release your hand out in front of you, this beam of divine energy streaks out, slamming into the zombie giant. As it hits, it continues to burn like a stream into its body, searing the flesh in a path as it does. As it impacts, it leaves this glowing, pulsing divine symbol across its chest of Sarenrae. The next attack against it has advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, but then he gets advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The thing is, you can use the minus five to hit plus ten to damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's what he's been doing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll use it on that one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you have advantage too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you have advantage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's even worse.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, that was better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh good, okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once again, big target, not very hard to hit, just has a lot of hit points.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 16 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 also hits.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That'll work. 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. All three hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Kill it with fire.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kill it with fire. Sorry. Ten, 11, 21--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus another ten for great weapon--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did it, yeah. That was 11 plus ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 25, all righty.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can these actors do addition?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I know. (laughs)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 33 points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Holy shit. Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The jaw hangs a little bit loose. The third strike, you come down, (whack) hit it from the other side. The jaw dislodges and goes flying off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Dibs! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it's still standing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Without a head?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just this open part. His tongue dangling loosely out of the bottom. Part of its head caved inward, just (deep zombie groan).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shove my hand up your skull and work you like a sock puppet! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to stay where you are, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Scanlan, you're up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How far can I move?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move 25 feet, so five squares.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 25? That's it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're a little gnome, dude. You have little legs.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I get next to Grog? Can I get near Grog? Can I get at an angle where I won't hit Grog with lightning?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can, but at pretty much every angle, you're going to hit somebody aside from the giant.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I guess I should. Pike's with me. I've got to do this right. Damn it! (groans) If only you weren't here, Pike. Pike, don't look!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You shoot it at an angle up at his head. Up into the sky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. I will try to hit him with a Lightning Bolt, but miss as many people as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's tall. He's down a little bit because of the impact that Grog gave, but at a higher angle, you could probably hit him without hitting the other guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I will angle up. This time, I would like the lightning to come from my ass.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're William Wallace-ing it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. And I'll just lightning him at normal lightning damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so 8d6 damage. Does not make its saving throw with a three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How can you even aim like that, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I have practiced aiming things with my ass in this campaign.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very true. Sadly.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (counts quietly) 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's looking pretty rough, but it's still keeping itself there, yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What? I just farted lightning on him!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Pike. You get a d10 inspiration dice from Scanlan, a voice you've longed to hear for some time, as your friendship has been so far away. Take your 1d10.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hear that, Scanlan? Friendship.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Friendship? Aw, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so on the zombie giant's turn, it recovers from the bolt of lightning, looking at this large target in front of it, it sees this tiny little morsel and you see it brings up its leg that's partially destroyed and (heavy footsteps) begins to move forward just to there, to get you within range. It's going to move a little closer. It gets two attacks of opportunity from the guards behind it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was about to say, the guard is there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Against it. Against it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That does hit, though, so it takes-- oh, nice-- eight points of slashing damage from one of the guards that, as it runs by, just swings out and slashes across its thigh. As it comes up towards you, it (zombie groan), its tongue dangling out, this horrible gurgling sound coming out of what is now technically its open throat. As it brings its club upward--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As my reaction, I bring up my shawm-- it's a horn-- and I blow the note. The note is like Dumb and Dumber, the sound he makes? (off-key horn noise) That most annoying sound. (off-key horn noise) And mash all my fingers down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Is this your--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is my trying to-- Cutting Words!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cutting Words? Okay. All right, well it rolled a 21 to hit. For Cutting Words, you roll a d10 and subtract that from the attack roll, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this?

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: That is a ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Big money, no whammies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, 20. Does that hit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Horrible shrieking sound.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, my shawm!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take 20 points of bludgeoning damage from the first strike and your shawm is bent and (weak horn noise) not quite-- you'll probably have to buy a new one or get that repaired. You almost lost a tooth in the process. As you're like, (groans) from the impact, you pull back and you can feel already, the pulsing of the blood from the veins that have burst. It brings up its club one more time. (roars)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is going to be a 13.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That misses! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This time as it brings its club up, you see the arc, and you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Four and a six. The six actually still hits. Six and a 20. There we go. And a critical, so miss and then a hit and a critical.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice natural 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Put some hurt on this undead bastard.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. Where are you at, Scanlan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But I'm right next to Grog. Grog and I are right in front of the giant.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Health-wise, where are you at?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm fine. Don't worry about me, baby.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so I'm going to go up to the giant, where the open wound is, where that guy just broke it open. I have Sprinter's Boots, if I can't get all the way up to it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you'll have to use those to get up to him.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'll use Sprinter's Boots.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to use my mace, and I'm going to start ripping where that wound is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, the open wound would be around here, but with Sprinter's Boots you can get there just fine, yeah. So you actually get around. All right, and you're technically flanking with Grog, so you have advantage on these attacks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So go for it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, so I roll--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll to attack twice and take the higher of the two. I know you've been filming for a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Roll the d20 twice?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roll two times, take the higher of the two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, that's the higher of the two?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That's the higher of the two. I had a seven and a 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that definitely hits. Roll for the second attack because you can use your bonus action to strike because you're a war cleric.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Nine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A total of nine?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you add it to anything?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, am I supposed to add something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add your attack bonus. Next to your weapon on your character sheet.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Shit. Sorry, guys!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all good. You've been too busy being in someone's Blindspot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're busy being in the lab.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, 17 again!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17 again. There you go. Both hit. Go ahead and roll the damage for the mace plus, if I recall...

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think it's 1d6 plus three. Plus seven if it's an attack hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 1d6 plus three, yep. You also have a Mace of Disruption, don't you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disruption. I think so, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What was the effect on that one? Do you have the item with you?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I do. Shit. No, I don't have the papers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stolen on the subway on the way home from work.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Guys, someone took it from me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also add an additional 1d8 damage to the first strike.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 2d6 radiant damage. DC 15 wisdom save.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's now frightened of Pike until the end of her next turn.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Awesome. All right, so you're rolling 1d6 plus three, plus another 1d8, and how much did you say for that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 2d6 radiant damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So 3d6 plus three, and then an additional 1d8 for each strike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, what?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wait, so one more time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why is she so goddamn powerful?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Undead, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cleric vs undead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You said 3d6?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 3d6 plus three, plus an additional 1d8 radiant damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For every roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: For both attacks, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For both attacks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Per attack.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is the best.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Undead.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We needed her from the get-go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, while she's rolling, can you describe her hair at this moment? Is it whipping around? Is it in her face? Is it covering her eyes in a sexy, sweaty way?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Matted with jam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's ignoring me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I use my d10? An additional d10 from Scanlan, for the inspiration?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not for damage. That was just to hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm getting carried away. Okay. 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 on the first hit?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, shit. I forgot the second hit!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 23 on the first hit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry, guys watching. Sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bring the holy retribution.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They'll understand.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I've missed Pike so much.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Me, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, I've missed you, too.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like your headphones, too, by the way.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Kill, kill, kill.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, 44.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The Mace of Disruption actually has a different effect. It's not about a frightened thing. If it has 25 hit points or fewer after taking this damage, it has to make a DC 15 wisdom saving throw, which it fails.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Which means?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: However, you, in the middle of your battle trance, Pike, rush up, shield ahead. You take the mace and, seeing the open wound, slam the mace in there once (wham). As you hit, the actual undead flesh burns away from the impact, leaving this ashy swath of missing flesh in its body. The creature gives out this weird, gurgly bellow (roar). Using that moment, as it rears back, how do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's gone. She ran away. She took her headphones off and did a lap.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I'm back. Oh my gosh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The magical power of this is essentially destroying the creature, so describe this however you want to, in your radiant cleric form.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay, I want him to just explode with a radiant glow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As he reaches back, you see this foothold on its knee as it's trying to keep itself aloft. You leap up, using your Sprinter's Boots, onto one of its knees. Jump in the air, dropping your shield and two hands on your mace, you leap in the air, slam it downward. As the mace impacts on the front of its chest, there's this brief moment of pause as it cracks into its flesh. Its head looks down at you, and there's a burst of divine energy as his entire torso (explosion) rips open. What would be organs within that exposed, however, are all also turned to ash as the body (death rattle) dissipates and disintegrates, falling into a puddle of liquid, messy, muddy ash and bits and pieces of remaining giant there. As Pike lands on the ground, 3-point landing, mace in one hand. Walks over and picks up her shield and looks over her shoulder at Grog and Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I faint?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He's always doing that. Welcome back, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) Oh boy. What the heck?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He steps forward. "If I might ask, who are you, and how did you do that?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Spread the word. It all comes down tonight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're with the de Rolos?"

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: (quietly) Not tonight!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Tonight, tomorrow, tit for tat. Whatever.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're not there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He is! He's there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just waking up. "What? What's going on?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It goes down in the next--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 24 hours.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't put a timeline on it. These things-- it takes a little time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're with the de Rolos?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aye, with the de Rolos.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then let it be done. Thank you for the save. We're going to gather our wounded and "prepare for the next attack."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Prepare. Wait for our signal. Spread the word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Men! Come!" And the three of them rush off. They gather up a few of their friends who are further down the road, all groaning and wounded, getting up and putting their arms over their friends' necks. Gathering the dead and pulling them off the middle of the road. You notice as they're pulling them off the road, each one of their dead friends, they're actually pulling out torches and lighting fire to their corpses.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they don't want them to come back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we loot? Should we loot them, first? (laughs) That would be in poor taste.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you guys doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Check the body for secrets.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to stay, or do we want to head back towards the other three?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should start heading back. We probably won't get there in time. Wait, Percy said to meet in the west.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right. We should head to the west, to the wall. To the city wall.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We'll head west to our appointed meeting spot.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wild, wild west.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vaguely west.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll perception.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we roll hit dice at any time during the day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Only during a short rest.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Got it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. Not in this weather. Not in this city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A yarmulke? Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. Whitestone? Not really a beret kind of people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it could be just a shoulder pad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like a sock. Sure! There's also no laundry left out during the middle of a rainstorm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe they're terribly irresponsible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It could be. Unfortunately, at this moment, no. You are unable to see any sort of a beret or could-be-fashioned-into-a-beret-type clothing piece.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No Dust of Tracelessness this time as we head to the western wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, Grog's getting bold!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're getting bold!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see that this zombie giant has been pushed back. You can just barely see the crest of him currently slamming some sort of large metallic weapon around, right over the treeline, as you approach the outside gate of the graveyard itself.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going stealth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I Hunter's Mark him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What's the range on Hunter's Mark?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a good question. It doesn't say.

lines.name: LAURA, TRAVIS
lines.text: 90 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 90 feet. You're probably going to have to get a little bit closer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, I Hunter's Mark him as soon as I can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, good to know. You guys all going stealth right now, or are you all rushing in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm just going to rush in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Keyleth's running.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The gates are slammed open; part of the metal's bent inward, like whatever was pushing the giant back at this point had slammed through the gate.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey, Vax?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm gone, man.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, you're gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I rolled a 23. Am I stealthed?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You feel pretty stealthy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You have an earring, though. If he's on his ass, you have a better chance of hitting him, correct?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, that sounds good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good to know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you guys all rush into the center here, looking about, you can see, this hefty graveyard that you visited about two days ago: all of the graves are open. All of them are excavated and open, and you're starting to see where they're pulling a lot of these undead from.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's just rude.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll initiative, folks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Initiative, initiative.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it! It's the second one I've rolled in a row.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am a monster. I am a monster!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to retire this one for a while.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You literally are a monster.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have really high initiative.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did I already Hunter's Mark him now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can now, yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And Matt? As we ran, I wanted to split off from the group and go up along the side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Along the side this way? Okay, so you'll be over here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I leap off Trinket as we get close.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh. (chuckles) All right, so 20 to 25? Anybody? 20 to 15?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. 26.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "Oh, I'm sorry. 26."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Oh, I was reading a book. Sorry."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, Shadow Turd.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to be hilarious.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what they call me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do something I've never done before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That brings us to-- Keyleth, what did you get?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Ten.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I'm distracted.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The image of this whole thing-- even though it looks like it's currently surrounded, its giant form, barely damaged at this point, is still a very ominous thing that strikes a bit of fear in your heart, causing you to hold back on your initial assault. And also worrying about not knowing how the rest of your party is doing. Percy, you start this off right now.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pull out Bad News.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take aim, and I'm going to wait for it to raise its club hand up. It's holding a club?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, from this view, you can see it's actually a very large morningstar.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Aimed shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, Percy roll! He's got shitty AC.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thankfully, it's got shitty AC. 16?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 16 does hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Drop it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you get down to the ground, (gunshot blast) the echoing explosive shot fired from the Bad News slams up as it lifts its morningstar in the air. Two of its fingers get blown off its hand, and the morningstar tumbles (boof) onto the ground, nearly crushing one of the guards nearby, who barely manages to sidestep as it (boof, boof) lands on its side right outside the temple of Pelor. Well done.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Next shot, I'm taking a sharpshooter shot. I'm reloading.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, reload with your second attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Taking a sharpshooter shot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll do my damage and then tell you. It was an aimed shot to the legs, so that's-- oh my god. 16, 26, 32 points of damage, and it needs to make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. What's the DC on it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god, this is insane. DC equals eight plus your proficiency modifier plus your dexterity modifier?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Proficiency modifier is four, dexterity modifier is--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It rolled a 16 and has a plus four modifier on constitution, so it makes the save.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Damn it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's okay. I still did a ton of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. (explosion) The blast took a chunk of its physical form. Splatters against the side of the temple. That ending your turn. It, having no hand at its disposal, it glances over with this slow turning head. (groans) Reaches over and grabs a big piece of the stone rubble that was destroyed from the corner of the temple. Picks it up over its head (grunts) and lobs it at you across the way. (whoosh, whoosh, whoosh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be a 21 to hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits? You take 28 points of bludgeoning damage and have to make a strength saving throw.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just strength saving throw?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I rolled a one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So it slams into you and knocks you off your feet, prone from the sheer impact. It rests on part of your arm and you have to (grunts) work hard to push it off. That will end its turn.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much damage did it do to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 points of bludgeoning damage. That ends its go. Vax, you're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm watching everything unfold. I see my sister roll up. I hold.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Vex?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I say, brother. You remember that giant a few years back?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I remember that giant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're up. And I shoot two arrows for my two attacks. One into his thigh and one into his breast, right here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it. Roll for two attacks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know which ones to go with!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They both fail.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They both hit. They're both 24s.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both 24s?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Identical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit, yeah. Roll damage for each.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. That's so crazy!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Same thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Plus 14 is... 26? 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, plus Hunter's Mark for both.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 2d6 on top of that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 33, 37 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 37 points of damage. (arrows flying and landing) It slams into the knee itself, pushing out the kneecap a little bit from the side of its softened flesh. The other one (boof) sticks and disappears into its torso. You don't even see the impact. It pushes through the flesh and vanishes into its very large--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, the whole arrow goes in? I wanted to leave some of it out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. We'll say for the piece of impact here. Okay, roll a strength check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I believe in you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is control over your strength on this one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? What did you roll?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your strength?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's saving throw. Wait. Wait, yeah! Oh, damn it. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. I was going to say, you have minus two strength. I know that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you release the arrow, hitting at a very defined mark, shattering part of its rib there in the front, and the arrow sticking out by about a good six inches or so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start running. Am I within 30 feet? It's hard to tell from here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I hit one ankle against the other on my boots and everything slows down around me a little bit, and I double my speed and run towards it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you use your Boots of Haste at the end of last session?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's been a long day. We've had three sessions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I feel like you used it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If there's doubt, then I can't do it. All right, I still run at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You could use a bonus action to dash, don't forget, as a rogue.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's what I do. He's surrounded by people, right? So, I'm going to run up to him and I'm going to start swinging up the arrows on his chest and get up to his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you run up, planting a foot on its thigh, leap in the air, grab onto the arrow that Vex left in its chest, whip upward, and while you're in the air towards its face, go ahead and make your attack.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, Legolas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You only get one attack because you used your bonus action to dash.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Never mind. Nine is a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have advantage on this, if you wish to roll. You technically have him flanked with the other guy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 26.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That hits, definitely.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, because he's surrounded. All right, so I'm up on his shoulders at this point. One plus seven is eight, plus ten, 11, 16, that's 21, 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 23 points of damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, with Flametongue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. So as you leap into the air, you bring the blade, slam into the center of its face, over one of the eyebrows. It slams into the skull, and using your weight, you tear down, dragging the blade across its face. The bone is brittle underneath its flesh, and it hacks part of its face open. The bone and teeth immediately become visible. Its jaw clenches and actually clamps onto your blade as it reaches the bottom of its face and you catch yourself there for a second, the horrible scent of its rotting flesh hitting your body. You manage to take your foot up, push off, pulling the blade out from under its toothy grasp, and you land on the ground right beside it. Big old jagged gash in the side of its face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Now the rest of the guards are going to go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Guards.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, natural 20. These are the resistance members.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't had a natural 20 in the game.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ever?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: In a long time. Except when I head-butted a fomorian.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Would you like to borrow my die and see if it does anything?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you keep your Golden Snitch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's just you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Keep your cheated die all for yourself, there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Harry Potter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 points of damage for the non-criticals.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's hollow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What is he doing? What's happening over there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends their turn. Keyleth, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so you're on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Landed beside him now, after he pulled the blade out of its face.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm right below his undead dinger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But there's a ton of people surrounding him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So light him up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to kill everybody if I start bringing down bolts of lightning. So I'm going to move up a little bit, to where I'm within 30 feet of him. Over here or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That'll put you just at 30 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I see Vax?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can barely see Vax. Vax is hard to see, period, but you can barely see Vax at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's night. He's in black.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So, looking at the giant and realizing that if I bring lightning down, I'll just start electrocuting everybody around, I meditate for a second and go super calm and start casting Heat Metal, and I start meditating on Vax's daggers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So your daggers are going to do an extra 2d8 damage. And he's up against a wall, correct?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's currently up against the edge of the temple, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to use my bonus. I'm running fucking low on spells. Fuck, I don't want to do it. I'm going to do my bonus action to cast Grasping Vine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so you're aware, Heat Metal does 2d8 damage to him for holding onto it. It doesn't do additional damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I say we move forward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to just take it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's done. She cast it. Let's go on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just letting you know for future reference.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. It's because it worked that way in Pathfinder. I used to do that with Grog's axe all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Stupid Pathfinder.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you also had to touch his axe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Vax, you immediately take 2d8 points of fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you have to make a constitution saving throw vs her DC, or you drop both of your daggers.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (weak laughter) Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's fun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Sam.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm laughing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a constitution saving throw. What's the DC on your spells?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My spell save DC? 18.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck a duck, that's hot!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both daggers just drop to the ground. As they both slam into the mud, (sizzling sound).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like, yeah. We're going to hurt this motherfucker so bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And then with your bonus action?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bonus action, I'm going to wrap him up with a Grasping Vine and try to restrain him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you open your eyes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm like, man, I'm such a fucking badass right now. What am I doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're going to restrain him with a Grasping Vine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I think he has to save against it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, make a dexterity saving throw or be pulled. It doesn't restrain, it just pulls them towards the vine. Since he's already against the wall, you can pull him away or toward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing you do does what you want it to do.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking fail.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Read the spells! The information's right there!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So you're pulling him towards you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can pull him towards the ground, can't you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can I pull him towards the center of the earth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of his-- sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. He fails on the DC. That's a total of ten. We'll say for the time being, he is considered grappled.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, man.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Man, I'm so cool right now. I'm concentrating so hard!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are these little cylinders of steam rising up from the ground where his daggers are currently (sizzling noise).

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And she's like, well, deal with it! It's going to be awesome!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn. We're back to the top of the round. Percy, you're up.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm pinned and annoyed. I'm shooting him in the face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you're prone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Am I prone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're prone. The boulder knocked you prone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, can I use my movement to get up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can. You get up and use half of your movement.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (grunts) I get up, shake it off, pull up for another shot. Shooting at his face. I'm reloading, shooting at his face.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're reloading and then shooting.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Bad News or Pepperbox?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 to hit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 15 does hit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 hits, so that's... ugh. That's 20 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And now he has disadvantage on his attacks for the next round.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so this is the headshot?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Reloading-- oh, I've actually--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've already used your action surge for the day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, it's a short rest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, it is a short rest? Yeah, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That hits. I'm out of grit points.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 32 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That also hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: His AC is eight, by the way. It's a big heaping pile of hit points. It's not hard to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pile of undead goo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've attacked it enough that you gather it's pretty easy to hit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there was a 12 and I was like, what?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 14, 24, 30 points of damage. And now I'm going to use my bonus action to heal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty. Go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Heal myself. That's 19 points healed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Now the giant, pieces missing out of its body, looks around and it reaches down and grabs-- yeah, it's going to use one of its attacks and grab the morningstar, and with its second act it's going to swing over towards you, Vax. You just slammed into its face with the dagger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he's grappled.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An 11 and a one. Grappling just prevents movement, but yeah, he goes in and swings wide and you just duck out of the way, dodge off to the side. (boosh) It slams and gets stuck in the mud and there's a (sucking noise) horrible sucking sound as it has to pull it out of the ground with all of its might. That ends its turn. This giant's in a bad place. You're up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What position is it in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's currently kneeled forward, just pulling its morningstar out of the mud.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (pants) I reach down and I grab the scalding-hot daggers again, and I lift them up, and lunge and sink into its ribs.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll it, Keyleth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So does he, right? Because that's kind of badass. Seven points of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, you roll? Seven or eight, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for the attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Two plus three, nine, ten, 11, 12, 15, 16, 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17. On the second attack, Flametongue gets seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven, okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus 2d8 for your fire damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, plus 2d8 for the fire damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does he also get the fire damage?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a yeah. If I get burned, he gets burned, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Since you're taking the damage to do the attack, I'll let it happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. 14.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So, as you're holding the daggers with the searing pain, you reach up, slash both daggers down into the front of its body and you drag across, you can see its chest breaks open and it (groans) stumbles backward, the air expiring from its throat. (roars) It pushes up against it, holding onto that shred of undeath that it currently has in its body, not falling to your measly blows. That ends your turn. Do you want to move at all?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I didn't move. Can I use a bonus action, at this point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You used a bonus action for your second attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Second attack? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, because you're not hasted. All right, go for it, Vex.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to shoot him two times through my Blazing Bowstring, which I still have one left of.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First strike will be the Blazing Bowstring?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That hits. Second one hits, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay! What's the Blazing Bowstring, again? 1d10, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You've got a lot of papers in there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 21, plus Hunter's Mark. 22 for the first hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hold on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Get it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that feels so good. As he's bent over, I want to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're wearing the shirt, even.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! I'm wearing the shirt! As he's bent over and I just saw my brother attack him with fire, I hit him with fire again, straight through the eyeball that's remaining, through the back of his head.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you release the arrow itself, you can feel the warmth licking the side of your face as the arrow heats up. Release it. It shoots through the air like a tracer dart, just (arrow whizzing). The giant, which is currently reaching back-- it has a palm out like it's going to try to palm Vax after the attack. As it reaches up, (groans) it just (arrow whizzing) into the back of the eye, and as it sinks inside its head, (thud) there's this dull thud sound, like the fire burst on the inside of its head. Its other eye (explosion) plumps out and hangs out the side as fire darts out from that open socket. Its jaw goes slack, and it begins to lurch forward towards you and the guy next to it. Both of you guys step back out of the way as it (moans, thuds) onto the muddy ground in front of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (pants)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone takes a breath for a second.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I start sticking my hands in a puddle.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I run up with Trinket to the guards.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go up to start seeing if I can salvage anything from this giant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like my hands?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I see Vax with his hands in the mud?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you see him currently putting out his hands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did-- what?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you fix these?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh. Did it work, though? I'm sorry.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, it worked, it's good, but they sting a little bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. I put my hands in his hands and cast Cure Wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to use it from my ring. My spell-slot ring.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What level?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll do level two.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Level two? Okay, so 2d8 plus six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you heal 12 hit points.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I heal. I also hold her hands for a second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk through and bust through their hands.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: There you go.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to talk to the guards.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The guards who currently are checking to make sure it's dead. They're stabbing its body.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Putting the guns away and walking over to the guards, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You notice, they look like guards at first glance because the armor they're wearing is the same type of armor that the guards you've encountered here wear, but they're all, underneath the armor, wearing rags, farmer's clothing, whatever's available. It's still uniform armor and weapon design to anyone who's worked in Whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are any of them in berets?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know because you're not there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Damn it!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are they unsullied?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I put my hand on one of their shoulders and say, you showed great bravery here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Thank you. Thank you for coming and helping. That got a little hairy there, for a "minute. We didn't lose any of our men, thankfully, and that's thanks to you." He reaches up for a second and wipes this black blood stuck to his chin from the fight. "So. What's next?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now we rest up. You heal, and you get ready to attack tomorrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. What time?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Tomorrow at dawn, we take the castle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Men."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spread the word.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Dawn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Dawn. Dawn it is." Sheathes his weapon. The other men stand up, and one of them makes one final stab into the body of the zombie, like, "Yeah. Take that." They begin to walk back towards town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Before he runs off, I tell him, "Tell everyone to look for the sign of "Pelor in the sky."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: One of them goes, "Pelor. Right." Three of them run back to the doorway of the temple, and they all stop for a second and give a silent prayer to themselves, and then join the rest of their crew as they go walking back towards the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right now? It's hard to tell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hopefully, it's a while until dawn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about two hours past sunset.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. We've got time! That's good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I pull out my Flametongue dagger and just look in two or three graves. I don't know if there's anything in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you trying to grave rob right now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're empty, man. That is a 15.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're literally going to steal from my great-grandfather?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm just looking.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Glancing about, you notice that the coffins are still there at the bottom, but they're all open. The lids are off, and they're empty entirely. Whatever body is gone. Best you can glance about, the most that you can find, most of them are just laid to rest. One of them seems to be laid to rest with what looks to be a nice ornamental dagger of some kind that's left to their side.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fucking do it.

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: (laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It could be cursed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do whatever you want. I'm not here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you giving me morality lessons?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm not even here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to check my family grave. The family crypt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There actually is an undercroft in your castle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's right!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to drop down. I'm going to take a look at that, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're going to go get the dagger?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to look at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That ornamental dagger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you leap down into the grave...

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tell me more about that dagger?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can see from up there, it just looks like a fairly nice dagger, it has a little like gold sheen to it, and looks like there's gems encrusted in it from this distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looks shiny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you leap down into the grave, drop, your feet hitting against the wooden bottom of the coffin. Smells musty and it's been rained in heavily, so it's not as bad as it could be. It looks to be a pretty dagger. You reach for it and pick it up and look at it, it's lightweight, it's ornamental, it's not actually more of a functional--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to make an arcana check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's ornamental.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just want to make an arcana check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it, go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It looks ritualistic and ornamental. It's probably worth a pretty penny, but it is not a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I put it down and I pat it and I--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Climb back up out of the grave.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He doesn't know!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I salvage anything from the stone giant?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Tourist, I'm a tourist.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a wisdom check, just roll a d20, add your six to it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just a wisdom check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 12 total.

lines.name: MATT
