lines.text: 12. Looking over the body, this entity and anything that would be functional on the stone giant's body is far rotted and necrosis has taken hold on a lot of the body parts. Nothing here would be of use in any way, shape, or form. Plus stone giants don't really have any magical components to their body, they're just larger humanoids. What small trophies you could take from it, you could sell here and there for a little bit of change, are also rotted and corroded by its undead form that it wouldn't be worth it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Their teeth are good for 1d8s, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) This is true. All right, so what's the plan?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should head west.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Head west, meet up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you guys--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I take the little bit of Dust of Tracelessness that we had taken from Grog and I try to sprinkle it on our tracks as we go and cover up our tracks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As you pull the dust out of your pouch, you look at it, and it's turned to just sand. It seems that the Dust of Tracelessness is effective when only pulled and used directly out of its pouch--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: By its designated flower girl.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If taken out remotely and left on its own for a while, it becomes magically inert.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well then, I use my ranger skills to try to make it look like our tracks are hidden.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know the city well enough to take us through a relatively--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. This is one of those few circumstances where Percy's almost more helpful than you are as far as making your way through. The two of you together? Very helpful. You guys have been making your way through the city, making westward to meet up with the rest of the party against the wall on the western side of Whitestone. And with that, we're going to go ahead and take a quick bathroom break, bring in some snacks. So hang tight, guys, we'll be back here in just a minute.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I love you, Pike! [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Taking your pee break now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. The rest of you guys gather, what are you doing? What's your plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're against the wall? Should we stay in the treeline?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to hide.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How is everyone? Did you defeat your giant?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know who defeated ours? Pike, because she's the fucking bomb.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, we've missed you so much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, come here and give me a hug! I give her a hug. What happens?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. (laughs) You go and hug her, and it's one of those things where because her form, it feels like you're grabbing almost a warm, energetic gelatin in a way, like her form isn't purely physical.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just how I remember you! Warm gelatin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And there is this hot wind that wraps around her and her hair is drifting a little bit. There's something, her physical form is very strange here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How did you get here, Pike? How did you know?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: But today, it became too much.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You had received a letter from Allura, from Emon, if you recall.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I received a letter from Allura, and I felt that you guys-- are you guys making a decision or something here in Whitestone?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Many decisions. We've decided to take down this horrible foe, and Percy's been grappling with a lot of decisions as we've gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, maybe you could help him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, can you take a look at him, Pike? I believe it's out of my realm of understanding.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, Percy's just fine. Maybe she looks at him after the Briarwoods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: There was a long pause.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: That was a very long pause.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Percy, how are you feeling?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Honestly, if Pike weren't here, I'd say fine, but... (sighs) How do you think I am, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Well, most of my... my heaviness and visions were about you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I've been in deep prayer and meditation, and I know you guys were in a very dark place, and I prayed that Sarenrae would send me to you. And so here I am, sort of as an avatar, but I'm here, and I want to help in any way that I can. I just know something's off, and I don't quite know what that is yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Her form shimmers for a second, almost like the energy that keeps her corporeal in this location for a moment flickers, and then she is restored to her form. You get the sense that--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This isn't going to last long.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This divine projection is a channeling of Sarenrae's power keeping her here for the moment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Damn, Sarenrae is really freaking powerful.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I have a feeling she's probably using a lot of energy to do this, too. Pike, do you know how much longer you can stay in this form, that you can stay with us?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know. This is the first time that I've ever done this, so I'm hoping that it will last a long time, at least to see you through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, us, too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Us, too.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (fake crying)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, Pike. Do you want to take Percy's temperature?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we find a place to hide first?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah. We're still in the open, right?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's a secret entrance to the castle to the west, in the woods. I think perhaps if we made our way there, we could--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Get inside?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Camp out, perhaps. It would be a roof over our heads if we got there, and we could take care of anyone--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Percy's thinking very clearly. He's fine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's rubbing his eyes a lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's had this weird cough for a couple of days now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's allergic to cats or something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not allergic to cats.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, he has black smoke coming out of his body all the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have lightning coming out of my ass.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, well, you choose to do that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's make our way to somewhere quiet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll have her look at you there. I do a Gust to do that air umbrella thing around all of us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That really terrible one that doesn't work well?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, the really terrible one. I'm doing that to help keep us shielded from the rain.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Are you guys coasting within the city's walls, or are you moving outside of the city's walls?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Outside of the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you find your way a little bit southward--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stealthing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stealthing, to make your way outside of the city, into the forest surrounding the outskirts of Whitestone. Make a stealth check, guys. This is without the plus ten bonus because you don't have any more spells.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Oh. Really? I get plus two to stealth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh. 20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 with disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Pike?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, what did you roll for stealth? She's an apparition!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You rolled a ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Clang!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Clang, clang, clang.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Percy presses along, coughing and keeping his eyes peeled, you press on for about 30 minutes to the north. The rain begins to subside a little bit, and you can hear the occasional (cracking noise) sound of these strange growling, cat-like noises. You know that some of the indigenous creatures of the Sierras--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I know what this sound is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're indigenous to this region; that's them communicating. It's initially off-setting, but you keep pushing forward. I would have both of you guys make survival checks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Survival checks?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think I've ever rolled that before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Come on, city boy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I have advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's true. And you would have advantage, actually, because you know this area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really? Did that just happen?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wow. She rolled two threes in a row.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got to retire it. It's so beautiful, and I keep trying it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's certainly the die, and not you in any way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's just been punishing me, as of late.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 14? Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The two of you, working together on this-- it takes you an hour or so before you eventually get further enough north and out of the outskirts of Whitestone where you begin to see the rising platform, the small central forest mesa that the castle Whitestone is built upon. You can see, through the heavy cloud cover, what little bit of torch light is visible from some of the castle interior in the distance. It's this ominous dark shape outlined against the cloud cover above you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everything that I am worried about.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The cough.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The cough. Everything, so that she's filled in on his darker turn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Did you get that, Ashley?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I did.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, coasting along the side-- I want you to make an investigation check, Percy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's no doorway. It was a cavern exit that was loosely hidden by a series of bushes that were clustered around it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It should be around here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I start taking a look around and see if I see anything?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All of us, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should be very careful. These two are good at using their brain muscles. Could be an ambush.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 26 on perception.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's way better than mine. 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: okay. You guys watch along the wall, and nothing seems to be catching your eye. You notice that there's a portion of the mountainside that is looser rock. Everything here is solid, long-eroded through weather and time. There is one section that appears to have more of a crumbly, loose rock that forms the lower portion of the wall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big guy, come here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm not very strong; do you want to start hucking rocks?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, say that again?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am extremely fast and nimble and could totally fuck you up, but I can't lift that much, including door jambs. Could you help me move these rocks?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I suppose. I go and I start moving rocks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You look very handsome in that beard.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make an athletics check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) Oh shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Never forget. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18, okay. You go over and start pulling the rocks away. A lot of the ones at the very surface are pretty small and you're pushing them aside and rolling off. Eventually, you start getting to the base of this area and you can see now, there are a cluster of bushes that have long died and are crushed under these rocks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does this look familiar to me?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be similar to the placement of where the bushes were that originally obscured the crawlspace that led into this tunnel.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think this might be it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, what happened here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did they blow it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it look like a cave-in, like somebody did it on purpose?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do a nature check to see if this is natural or man-done?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Go for it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: "Man-done."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think that's a 21.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Inspecting this, the pattern in which it fell was very localized, which leads you to believe--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think this was blasted down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, this was blasted or was intentionally done to demolish this exit as opposed to a natural fall. At this point in time, you've pulled through a few of the larger rocks, and you roll them over and you do reveal a small tunnel.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Hey, look! I found a hole.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good work, Grog.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: About 15 minutes of pushing this stuff out of the way before you eventually find it, and it's probably a good ten feet inward.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we get in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's tight, but you can start moving in there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, squish in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we have two gnomes with us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She'll light up the hole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will shimmy in, just to see what's down there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You make your way into this lower tunnel. A bit sharp in there. Black as night; no light source. The ground itself is very dry, which is a nice change from the rather wet exterior awaiting you outside. It generally smells musty and seems disused. And very dark.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I lean down and say, does it look like somewhere that we can rest for the night?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got a torch up there, or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I flip my Flametongue dagger over backwards and hand it to him through this little hole.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You take the dagger.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This feels so cool. It's like a shortsword for me! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With the flickering light along the blade, it lights up the area. The tunnel widens up to roughly eight to ten feet wide and seems to curl forward before disappearing around a gradual edge about 50 feet ahead of you. It's about six feet tall, so the taller of you folk are going to have to crouch in, but it's about six feet tall, about eight to ten feet wide, and that continues to curl deeper in towards the mountain.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one down here, but I don't know how far this thing goes, and I don't know how well it's guarded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are there trees around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. No more than maybe five feet off this mountain line, the forest grows immediately dense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If they've blasted in the entrance, I have a feeling--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think they're expecting anyone from here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're not expecting people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This was taken care of, in their minds. I say we squeeze Grog and Trinket in here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And camp in the tunnel?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. I'll go ahead a bit and take a quick peeky-poo.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't think they'll patrol this area?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does it seem like there's cobwebs? Does it seem dusty and disused?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you crawl inside to look...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we inside? Let's all crawl in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys all may your way inside, glancing about-- make an investigation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I light up my hands.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I put Vax's dagger in my back pocket. Cover it up with my shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah, there's been no footsteps in here for quite some time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This has definitely been disused. Disused? Is that a good word?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Abandoned.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: "Abandoned" is a better word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As she's saying this, you look over and Scanlan almost looks at you directly and goes like-- He grabs your wrist and stops you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I use the other hand and I tweak his nose as hard as I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not in front of Pike! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Dagger's retrieved.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pike, can you take a look at this cough before we take a rest?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, take a look at him, Pike.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are we in the tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're in the tunnel right now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I grab some of the boulders and cover up the way we came in. Or just a boulder, and move it to the mouth of it. Or is it too big?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can move a few. There's no boulders quite large enough to fully close it off. You can do it; it will take you a little bit of time, but you can do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, just to cover it up a little.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Are there two openings? The one that we came in, and then the rest of the tunnel?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The tunnel continues and curves out of sight, about 50 feet in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we blocked up the one we came through.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, Keyleth? Can you make a fucking bush grow in front of this thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or can you put up a wall to where we don't have to worry?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So if whoever was going by with those dogs while we were up in the trees the first night we got here comes by and sees a hole in the wall...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many spells do you have left?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (sighs) That's the question. It depends on if we're going to decide to--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we should take a rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have to rest, yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll think about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Could I put a Guardian of Faith above us before we make our--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of course you can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see how long that lasts for.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it lasts for eight hours.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We came to a land of evil without--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, you can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't believe we came without Pike, ever.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, stay with us forever.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Or at least through next week.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you guys are having this conversation, Pike grabs her holy symbol for a second, closes her eyes, and focuses, and the energy around her, that slightly drifting, ethereal divine energy, seems to shift away from her for a second and then coalesce into what looks like a floating, ghostly, armored entity that apparates in the air beside her. Her form once again becomes whole, and she looks towards it and gives it a nod, and the armored entity seems to acknowledge with a strange head nod and then turns towards the inner side of the tunnel and begins patrolling a small section of the tunnel on its own.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Well, there you go.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I smack her on her little gelatin back and say, good work, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) I go over to Percy. Percy, how are you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know. I've had a cough, and I'm... complicated.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did a check on him, Pike. His cough doesn't seem to be anything natural or disease-related, so it's nothing like a fever. Not a real one, anyway.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh boy. Okay. Can I do any extra check on him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. Drop your pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can make a medicine check on him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're getting the radiant digit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Did anybody already do a medicine check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't made one.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: All right. I'll give it a go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (quietly) Come on, Pike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17? Okay. You take a moment to inspect Percy, looking at his features, checking his pulse, and generally getting a sense of his life force in general. His eyes are sunken, his jowls are shadowed. From what you recall of Percy, he was always a seemingly-healthy, if on the thin and pale side, individual. Doubly more so than you've ever seen him. There is an unrest to his energy, and there is no physical, natural illness or discernible disease, but there is something unsettling about his presence that you've never sensed before.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sighs) Okay. Lesser Restoration, would that do anything in this situation?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What about Greater Restoration?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can try it. Lesser or Greater Restoration.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If you have a Greater Restoration, Pike-- I don't have it on me.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay. I can try it. Can I try it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, if you want to.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So what are you casting? Lesser or Greater Restoration?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'll do Greater. Do you mind, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. (sighs) No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can remove a corruption point from yourself.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ooh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A corruption point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He had two.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's still looking a little sickly, but definitely improved.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Did I heal, as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, you just lose a corruption point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So does that get rid of one of his weird ailments?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He still coughs.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I do feel better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cough is still there.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I watched all of that, and when I saw him lean back into the earthen wall, I quietly back up and I'm going to go down the tunnel, like 50 feet, and see--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a stealth check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, that was incredible.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What is a corruption point?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea what a corruption point is, but you removed some point of corruption in his body.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can you do me next? My neck has been hurting for weeks.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I do that to Grog. How's that feel? How's that feel, big guy?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it's much better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Almost like a small seed of sentient tumor, you removed from him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should I randomize which corruption point vanishes?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a compounding thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, it's compounding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. They're not specific.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How many do you have?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. You have no idea.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Sorry. I'm asking too many questions.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. How dare you? No, it's fine.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How do you feel, Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (coughs)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But he's still coughing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm still coughing, but I feel much better. Thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What did you just do to him, Pike?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is going to sound like a very weird question, but does part of you want to hold onto some of this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll see where we are tomorrow.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: While this is happening, Vax has vanished ahead into the tunnel on his own. You guys look around and realize that he's nowhere to be seen.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Vax, pushing ahead. Thankfully, in the darkness, you have a little bit of vision, limited as it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From the glowing gnome?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. As you turn around the corner, you lose the light source.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You continue around the edge, and the tunnel evens out for a bit and then goes straight, and then curves again to the left. Following that, it curves again to the right. You can keep going, or you can head back. You've traversed about 60 or 70 feet in this tunnel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 60 or 70 feet? I'm going to go another 60 or 70 feet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where the fuck are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep pushing towards this tunnel and turn to the right. You travel a bit further forward, and as the tunnel makes another sharp right turn, you see all of a sudden where the dirt stops and there is solid, smooth stonework: a broken portion of what looks like the back side of a wall of some kind. You see nothing beyond it. It looks like there is a piece of stone something pressed against it, and looks like some other things are stacked, basically covering this entrance.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would like to just sit down on the ground and close my eyes and listen for a full minute and see if I hear anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Pretty good. I quietly walk all the way back, and walk behind the group, and I go, goosh! Look at that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I swear to Pelor, if you would have gotten us killed...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where did you go just then?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I was like ten feet around the corner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He was right here the whole time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to take care of a little business outside, and then we'll seal up the opening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Excuse me? What are you doing outside?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to charge the Diplomacy glove.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's already sealed. Grog already sealed it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Grog already sealed it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. He pulled rocks into it and closed the exit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I glare at Vax and I lay down to go to sleep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we do it here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can't do it in here because it would make too much noise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This room won't fit my storm cloud.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. Pike, do you have any sort of Cone of Silence, or anything? Do you have a Cone of Silence?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's going to make noise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, it's not going to work.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got this. I pick up two small, roundish, oval-shaped stones from the ground, and I slide them into Grog's nostrils, plugging them up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a sleight-of-hand check. Grog? What's your passive perception?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's passive perception?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's under all your other attributes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin breathing heavily through the mouth in reaction.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (loud snoring)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wake up to the terrible-- Ugh! What is that? Grog!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With a high velocity.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm removing one hit point from my--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. One beans you in the side of the temple.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Covered in Grog "boge." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sleeping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And the guardian that Pike conjured is guarding us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Is there, just keeping ever vigil for the next eight hours.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Chilling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's fucking rest!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who's still awake?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be careful when you go to sleep. Shit falls in your nose.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you guys taking shifts, or are you leaving it to the guardian?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Leave it to the guardian.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The guardian's got this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look at Vax before we go to sleep, and I say, not going to pull any more jenga moments, are you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. No, I'm not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You sure? Because you just did that secret walkaround there. We notice when you sneak off. You do know that, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But I'm not going anywhere.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. Hey. I was the only one who didn't give you shit for that. Just keep that in mind.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I did. You can fuck off and get yourself killed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're asleep.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (snores) (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to go sit down by Percy, and what I'd like to do is watch everybody nod off, and in 20 minutes, nudge him awake.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (groans)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Hi.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want you to get some sleep, but I want to talk for a minute.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if I can do both of those things, but okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's all right. We can separate them. This thing.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you really know about it? How do we know that this thing isn't whispering in Sylas's ear? What do you really know about this thing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I want to tell you something. We're almost like family now, and I've seen you do many great things, and you have earned my trust, but if you hurt my sister... If you hurt anyone else in this group inadvertently--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would expect no less.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, then.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax? I have a sister!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's pretty cool, isn't it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm hoping.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, hold onto that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I shall.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I let out a little sleep fart.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I borrow just a pinch of your black powder?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm running really low. No.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just a finger dab?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No. Oh, god. Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I lick my pinky and I put it in, and I slowly draw a big ballsack on Grog's forehead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a sleight-of-hand check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to sleep before this happens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a 23.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog, roll a perception check, just for the hell of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deftly blended in with the tattoos, unless those who are aware, there are strange new series of markings across Grog's face that he may not notice for quite some time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did do little hairs on them, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, how detailed.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, it grows here, so it grows there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't know. (laughs)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know. Or do I?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh! All right. You guys go to sleep?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He goes to sleep. I'm going to do my duty with Keyleth for a watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, Keyleth went to sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought we were both staying up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look back over at Keyleth, and she's asleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. I'll watch everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you going to sleep at all?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll stay up for two hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a flash of what looks like a skull, a skull face. The skull brings itself to where you focus on one of its ocular sockets, and blood begins to pour from the socket. Flash to black. A familiar voice rings out again: "Do not forget our deal." Cold morning air comes to you as you all slowly come to consciousness. Uncomfortable, kinks in your back. It's not the best place to sleep, but the bare minimum of the long rest is achieved throughout the evening. As you all eventually come to and check and make sure everyone's okay, you awake, a little unnerved.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I look around for Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is she still here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would like everyone to make a constitution check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Constitution?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Corruption, man.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, you're right. I'm going to go sparkle stone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Son of a fuck. Natural one. My third of the evening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Five.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You rolled a one, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I had bad dreams.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The DC on this is not as high. Everyone but Keyleth passed. Keyleth, as you wake up, there's a general cold sensation within your body, and you feel like there's really no way to keep warm, no matter how hard you try and bundle up. You even use a bit of Druidcraft to create a bit of sparkling warm fire that you use to keep your hands set, and the cold doesn't seem to go away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I keep my hands aflame and kind of rub myself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Your hands are shaking unnaturally, and there's a general chatter to your teeth. You have disadvantage on any dexterity ability checks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Glad I don't use a bow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Skill checks. Wouldn't affect attacks. I will say it doesn't really affect initiative, per se, but if you were to try to do any delicate handwork, you would have disadvantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we, before we get this shit going, have a feast? A big fucking feast?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should have a feast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That sounds good, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We still have a couple of feasts left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I will say, if we choose to feast, I will not be able to Sunbeam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that is a problem.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we have feasted last night?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I couldn't. I burned my Sunbeam. We couldn't have done it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike can't help in any way?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't know if Pike--

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't have that ability.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does she have access to sixth-level spells? We haven't leveled Pike up in a while.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I don't know if I've--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've gained a modicum of experience while you were away from the party, just at a slower rate, so you are at a lower level than the rest of the party. Not by a terrible amount, but you'd be level 11 by now, probably.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So she would have a sixth-level spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So she has Feast.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It depends on if clerics have it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clerics do have access to Heroes' Feast.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let me check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But that would also mean Pike burning her 6th-level spell slot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. So you would have one 6th-level spell. If you wanted to, you could prepare that as your prepared 6th-level spell for the day. That is your choice, Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We get saves on all wisdom throws, which might come in handy when we're fighting against things that control our minds.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh dang. I haven't even looked through these yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: While the fancy people are talking, I walk over to Grog and say, big man. You've got mud or something on your face. Come here. And I take my hand and I wipe across his forehead and smear out what I did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't fucking touch me!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: God, get it together.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I lean over to Vex and I go, how do I look?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You look lovely, dear.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Damn right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I have questions for us, while Pike is looking up her spells. First question is: how on earth are we supposed to send a signal to the rest of the town when we're in a tunnel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can open it up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: From where?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: From here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once we're inside the castle, we'll be able to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can Skywrite again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could Skywrite right now, as soon as we decide to start moving.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I just need to move the boulders a bit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Open the rocks up. People start attacking the castle; we come from the other side, from within.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that our plan? We're going to say, "Rebels, go," wait a while, and then attack?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not even wait a while. We'll go in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go in at the same time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We throw the signal to the sky and go up this tunnel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shouldn't we wait a little?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait like five minutes to let them rabble up and start running.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Remember, last time I was supposed to create a diversion...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but then you took down a whole house.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we had a Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Believe me, I was amazing, but maybe we should incite the rebellion, wait a half hour, and then go.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's see if we can keep civilian casualties to a reasonably small amount.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're the most capable people in this town right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, that's another question. We are. Does one of us need to go out there and lead the rebels?

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean, no?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They've got Yennan. He's awesome. He was a badass cleric.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he survived the night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if they don't take the rebels seriously because we're not with them? Maybe one of us should go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe Pike should.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think it's going to take all of us to defeat the Briarwoods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we all need to go together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once the Briarwoods are gone, I think a lot of this will get a lot easier.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could meet in the middle.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just saying, if Pike is fading on us, it might be best to send her out to lead the rebels.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, she's not fading on us, you dick! She's coming with us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, we're going to make a leap of faith that Pike can stay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And if, in the horribly unfortunate scenario where she can't. Pike, can you leave us anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A Heroes' Fucking Feast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A potion. A spell. A prayer. A symbol. A "siggle." Anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A sigil.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Oh, a sigil. I said it wrong.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, prepare to be GIF'd, Mercer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Yeah.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Wow. There's some amazing-- just a side note, there's one called Heal that can heal a person 70 hit points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: True.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Just like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's pretty awesome.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, Heroes' Feast, Heal. You've got to pick one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Heroes' Feast!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Heroes' Feast raises all of our hit points higher.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Way to humble-brag, Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It makes us more badass.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah, let's do the Heroes' Feast, then.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going to eat up? Fuck yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so mark off your other thousand gold chalice that you had purchased beforehand. I think you're out now, aren't you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, I believe we need to go shopping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You needed one more. You had one more, I thought.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She'd purchased two before you left.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, you wouldn't happen to have a thousand gold-worth chalice on you, would you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Only astrally.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never mind.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would think probably not.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't worry about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You mark a symbol in the dirt in the center of this tunnel in the shape of a giant rectangular table. You take your holy symbol, remove it from your neck, and thrust it into the ground at the head of the table. With that, dust kicks up as seemingly out of nowhere, this giant table and feast just (fwoosh) rises.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, is it a holy feast? Do we all do holy damage now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, but holy shit, it's delicious.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) "Holy shit, it's delicious." (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is very good.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Best line of the night!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Benches around and available. You all sit around it and dig into the most delightful mid-tunnel, cold sub-castle breakfast you've ever had.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ice cream.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Give me that pencil.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys all, for the next 24 hours, have advantage on wisdom saving throws, and I believe it's 2d6? Is that what it was, Marisha?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 2d10 or 2d8.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll look it up right here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wisdom advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's 2d12.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Heroes' Feast. Nope, 2d10. Everyone, roll 2d10 and add that temporary hit points to your HP value. That includes you, too, Pike. So roll 2d10 and that's temporary hit points on top of your regular hit points. Meaning once those go away, they cannot be healed back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Still not cracking a hundred.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nice!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And advantage on wisdom saves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we're immune to fear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Seriously?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And poison, I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. You're immune to poison.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Immune to fear, immune to poison, and immune to what else?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you get advantage on all wisdom saving throws. Heroes' Feast, motherfucker!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Immune to fear, and what was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Immune to fear and poison. Oh, such a good spell. Very expensive, but damn if it hasn't been clutch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to move out some rocks. Just enough where I can peek out. Are we ready to go?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go? Go where? What?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To do this!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just going to start this. We can talk as we go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've got to go outside first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going outside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going outside. Is it still rainy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is not raining, currently. The sky is still cloudy and dark.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still cloudy?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, so I take the clouds and I darken them and do a giant de Rolo crest that expands over the whole city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so with Grog's help, you move some of the rocks out of the way. You get a visual of the sky. You lean out, focus, cast your Skywrite spell-- mark that spell off-- and as you coalesce the clouds to be extremely dark and to form the de Rolo crest symbol in the sky. As that happens, you begin to see, about two minutes later, little beacon lights begin to ignite across the city: lanterns and torches being lit. It looks like, as it is probably an hour past dawn, that the surviving remainder of the Whitestone rebellion is raring itself to attack.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should have sung "One Day More."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we still can. (laughs) Before we do this, I love you all, and I wish us all the best of luck today. I especially love Pike, and I'm so happy she's with us for this. If some of us don't return, I think that the glory of what we're doing today, and the justice of what we're doing today, has been worth it, and Percy, I hope you get some sort of redemption in all of this.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To the de Rolos.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To the de Rolos.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To Vox Machina.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To Vox Machina.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You may raise your glass and drink if you'd like, Ashley.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh, thanks!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There we go. (laughs)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys finish your drink, the Heroes' Feast slowly sinks back into the dirt, leaving the empty tunnel before you. The slight cold sound of drifting wind through the now freshly barricaded rock exit of the secret passageway begins to reach your ears. What do you wish to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to check the wall?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm taking point. I want to check out that wall that I sat right in front of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's all go down the tunnel.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yep. Come on, everyone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I light up my hands for light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Very quietly down the tunnel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Immediately on the other side of this opening, now that you have a better look at it, it looks to be some sort of stone sculpture or statue of some kind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (sneezes)

lines.name: LAURA, MATT
lines.text: Bless you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see what looks to be the back side of some armored soldier, but it's all carved from some sort of marble. At a closer look, too, Percy, you see it's carved from the white stone that is actually mined in this--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do I recognize this part of the passage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do. This statue is one of the large things used to hide this exit, and it is normally shoved out of the way. There are a few other boxes immediately adjacent to it, and from what little bit you can glance past it, it looks like this section is used for storage of some kind and is filled with whatever random crates and whatever needed to be placed down here to keep it out of the way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can someone check to make sure that it's just a statue?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I do an arcana check to see?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If it's magical? Magic trap?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to perception it. 20 on perception.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Natural 20. Making up for those fucking ones.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. As you step up and inspect the back of the statue, the stonework is very well done, and there is a very, very faint magical essence to this statue. It's so miniscule, and the only reason you're able to pick it up is you're so fine-tuned to seeking out that presence. It doesn't have a specific form; it doesn't have a specific school of magic applied to it. It just has a general, faint magical aura.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is it carved out of the rock?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's carved out of the white stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Got you. But it's not magically trapped?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct. It doesn't appear to have any sort of strong magical presence for a specific purpose.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And if we touch it, we're not going to be possessed or something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't think so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I silently signal to everyone, and I slowly stealth around the statue to check out the room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. It's all pressed against the wall. The widest gap is about that wide. You're going to have to push or shove things out of the way. All the crates are pushed up against it, blocking the whole exit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it too big for you? Do you need maybe somebody stronger?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I reach out past my sister and pat him on the shoulder.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) I think you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where? Up where?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think you need to move the fucking statue.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Quietly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (whispering) Oh. And I gently start to push the statue out of the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a strength check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no! Really?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's a one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Natural one?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Grog cracks his fingers and grins, stepping up. Goes to push the statue, and then pop! Something in your lower back gives, and (groans).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Peacock a little more for us, please.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The air escapes your lungs, and it's been a long time since this injury has crept up, but you threw your back out a little.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I slide down and go, you know, I'm so tired of (groans) taking all the glory. Why don't you guys--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket? Trinket tries to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket, who, at this point in time, by the way guys, takes up a large portion of the tunnel--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, he wants to get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pushes past you guys and turns around and puts his rump against it and starts backing up into it. (moans) Go ahead and roll a d20.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please defeat this door.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fucking doors!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (whispering) Can you please fix Grog's back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Doors of Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doors of fucking Whitestone! Oh god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Add two to the roll.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Only two?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't add his full strength? It doesn't fucking matter, because I rolled a three.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Doors.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Perpetually defeated by passageways and entrances.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Curse you, doors!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've got this, guys.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, before we use-- listen. This could potentially be humiliating for all of us. Before we expend any of our arcane abilities, please let us all at least try and fail before you take out the Hand.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's all push.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As much as we can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, why are we pushing this thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's do the one and a half elf push, shall we? You, you, and me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll join.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will push, as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All the average-shaped people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm rolling my giant foam dice for this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Everyone but Grog can help in this. Grog, you're out for this one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm helping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He's helping.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am not helping.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, I rolled a 19!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One, eight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, is this just a strength check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, adding your strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Straight strength?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (grunts)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you give it a good solid try, the force of you guys combined; there is just a lot of weight pressed up against this statue with the crates on the other side. This storage room is very full, and you find Vox Machina, for all of its journeys, battles, victories, and celebratory events, bested by a room of clutter. Pike, did you want to give it a shot?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I turn around and I'm still pushing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, Pike's going to do this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Pike. Roll a d20 and add your strength modifier.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Come on, Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doors, man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Charge at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is like the lid of a jar; everybody's loosened it up, and Pike's going to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Plus your strength modifier?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled an 18 and my strength modifier is one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. As you guys all take a moment to have this discussion, Pike steps forward, her hair drifting behind her, buoyant in the air.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Somebody draw it. Please draw it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She steps up and centers herself. Sets her shield to the side, puts her mace down, closes her eyes, puts her hands on the statue and just (grunts) begins to shove and push. As she does, you guys hear (stone scraping noise).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Seriously?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could have done that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The crates begin to push and move out of the way, and she pushes the statue a good six feet ahead, pushing some of it out of the way, leaving a little bit of opening and a visual walkway into this basement area.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It must be nice to have the strength of Sarenrae.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pike, you saved the day. Again.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mrs. Shorthalt, you are amazing.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Whoa, Scanlan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket gives a (grumpy grunt).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike, will you carry me over the threshold? (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait! I fistbump Pike, pop my hood up, and then quietly go into the room.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not yet!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah! I'm the best person to do this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I have Trinket step on my lower back, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket's really good at that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is really good at massages. Trinket begins going, (grunts) stepping on you (cracking) and you hear--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (groans) Thank god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm going to have you roll a stealth check--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 29 for stealth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disadvantage?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of Grog's moaning at the massage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's fine. That balances out, and my first roll was a 29 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right across from you appears to be a central room or space. You can make a little bit of visual around you, but best you can see is there are a series of bars. Like cells, arranged across some of the walls here. You appear to have stumbled upon the subterranean Whitestone dungeon or prison.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can you help me understand the makeup of it again? You said two passages-- one to the left, one to the right-- and a chamber directly ahead, between them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know we've got two paths, but he said there's a room, as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Here, this will be a good perspective for you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you just happen to have the room drawn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's where you guys came through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And see this path here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And here. And there are cells on this side.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there anything good in the storage room that we're in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, you're in the storage room?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an investigation check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I start opening up crates.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's not great. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a lot of broken building materials.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a few crates that have residual whitestone in them, but it appears that most of it has been used or taken elsewhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like whitestone dust?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like dust and small rocks here and there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I gather some up in a bag?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I pick up a few pieces too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You, seeing both of those paths--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So both paths, and there's a room closer to me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, around the way to your left, you see that's the source of a little bit of sconce torchlight.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Into my little earring, I say, (whispers) I'm not doing anything fucking crazy, I'm just going to go ahead. This is the only thing I can do. And I move quietly into the close chamber.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, as you're moving forward, you hear behind you the sound of crates shifting, lids moving, because searching through a room of large clutter and crates makes noise. You take a few steps and that happens and you're like, and you hear echoing from around a corner a voice go, "Hello? Is someone there?" This really crackly dry voice.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I stop moving entirely and I just wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Silence.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And can I hear anything besides that? There's nothing else I hear besides that in this room?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you can tell, no.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's no dim light or anything?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The only dim light is coming from around that corner, from the source of where that sound seemed to come.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I should be able to see, then, if there's dim light. Up to 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Nothing immediately in your visual perspective. If you go all the way to the edge, you can look past the corner if you want.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. I slowly back up away from that and creep up the hall and stop at the corner before it turns and I just lean my head out and I listen.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Listening for a second, you hear what sounds like some shifting, like a body shifting over some sort of low crumbling. Sounds almost like grasses or hay or some sort of soft bedding is being shifted a little bit. You hear a clink of metal of some kind, you're not sure quite what the source is, and a couple of other small shifting and grinding sounds of metal. Comes to a halt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stop. There's two passageways up the way. I think we're in some sort of dungeon--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I could probably confirm this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very much so. This is where you woke up, where Cassandra pulled you--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is absolutely the dungeon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I had surmised as much. There's possibly an old person in one, and then sounds of something, so both of the chambers are occupied. I came back to confer with you instead of going off on my own because that gets me in trouble.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, thank you so much.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One time only.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go talk to the old prisoner.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What do you want to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Are we sure they're prisoners?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you want to talk to the possibly old person with the crazy eyes thing?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shouldn't we ask Percy what he wants to do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You right now are staring off into space, because you recall the last time you were here you woke up in a cell next to a cell that contained a pile of bodies of previously related members of your family before Cassandra ushered you out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to start making my way in that direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So as you guys are having this conversation, Percy just starts walking--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Percy, you probably want to take out one of those contraptions of yours.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, before he goes I cast Pass Without a Trace on everyone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Everyone who wishes to be stealthy can be stealthy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm rolling along with Percival.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm being stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Everyone roll stealth.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Me too, I'm super stealthy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll keep with your consistent roll, currently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. With plus ten?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's with plus ten.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's 30 this time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten! Because I cast Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, 40 this time. Only with her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Only it would be like (whoosh) what'd you get, Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike, what'd you get? Yeah, roll your stealth, girl. Plus ten to it.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughs) I have three.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But plus ten!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can I give her seven of mine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. You guys push down the left hallway or the right one?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm heading towards whichever cell had been mine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cell that would've been yours would be kind of on the opposite side of the room from you, on the other side. The fastest way would be taking the left path towards the light source.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The left path.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you guys head that direction, kind of following Percy--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not the direction of the voice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, it is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You move towards the light. You guys turn around the corner and look. Not in the cell you were in, but across the way, because there are six cells, three on each side of the hallway facing each other, and on the far cell on the outside-wall side of it, you see there's a torch sconce that is lit and just slowly crackling. It's almost reached ember period, like it's about to be changed out, probably. And inside you see, sitting just squat on the ground, in a cell by herself, this woman facing away, back up against the bars and that's all you can see.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Drawing a blade just in case.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As I approach I put my finger over my mouth and look at her. Can she see us?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Looking away.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's facing away from you guys, her back is up against the bars. She's kinda--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Psst. Oi. Hello.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Shh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Turns her head and looks over, and it's the first time you see her face. Much older woman, probably in her early seventies or so, but seventies living in a not very-- seventy years in a hard life, so very deep, sunken wrinkles. The skin is very weathered. Her hair is mostly whitish-gray with a little bit of you can see remaining reds and browns in it, at some point she might've had much brighter-colored hair. Her clothing is pretty ragged, and she leans over and looks to you guys, squinting her eyes in the darkness.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you want to get out of here, don't speak loudly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. Who is this?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're here to help.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still kind of looking out into the darkness. She can't see you guys really. She just hears your voices.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who are you?" She's being very guarded right now and very spooked.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the darkness, I hand, stupidly, my Flametongue dagger to Scanlan again and push him forward with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hold it up to my face. I grin a big grin to her and I say, hello. We're friends. We're here to bust you out of this place. Will you tell us who you are?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm Gloria. Gloria Cyn."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Gloria Cyn?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How'd you find your way in here?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We are ninjas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks very confused at you. "Are you friend or foe? Do you work with the Briarwoods?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we are against the Briarwoods and all they stand for. We're here to save you, the prisoners, the village. Everyone we can.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do all of you step forward at this point, or is it just you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just him. Mr. High Charisma.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I am not alone. I have friends with me. Some of whom look quite scary, so don't be alarmed if a bear stands right behind me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "A bear?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a good bear. It's the best kind of bear.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's the cutest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who is that?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's my friend Vex. Vex, come forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I walk up a little bit behind Scanlan and I insight check her to see what the fuck is going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, roll insight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know, they've all been betraying me! Don't you. Oh, that's good! 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24, okay. I mean, she's in a cell in a dungeon and looks to be fairly spooked but also guarded. Not much to read beyond the fact that she's an old woman in a dungeon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, she's definitely staying guarded in the circumstance, but you're not picking up any sort of strange animosity.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why have you been locked up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Delilah laughed and threw me in here, saying I'm a fair better offering than a fisherman. That's the "last I know. I've been here for over a week."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A week, that's it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would say it's almost safer for her down here for now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. So here's the thing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're great with old people.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: They don't take prisoners.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a lot of violence that's going to happen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We should unlock that, maybe we should unlock this cage.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No. We should keep her in here for now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they don't take prisoners, they don't take prisoners. Why isn't she fucking dead? Or undead?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She can run out the tunnel that we came in.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, why don't we unlock her and just let her book for it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait. If we destroy the Briarwoods, it will be no trouble to come down here and let anyone out who's down here. If she's who she says she is, we don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Madam. Good madam. When you were brought into the castle, can you tell us anything about where you were brought? Were you brought before the queen-- she is a queen, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, she's a lady.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lady. Were you brought before the Lady, and if so, in what room? Where was it? How big was it? How many guards were in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They brought me into the main grand throne chamber to speak with the lord and lady. They "ushered me through the halls and we waited about an hour for them to arrive. Apparently they were "busy elsewhere. There was a brief discussion. They laughed at me and threw me in here."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You have beautiful eyes. Did those eyes see anything in that grand throne room? Entrances or exits? Large windows? Anything?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know all of them. I did live here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, fuck. Never mind, Matt. "Were there any guards? Many guards? Lots of guards?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tens, dozens. I did not feel right at that moment, and then, well, my fate was brought into this "terrible cell." She kind of looks about.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Has anybody been coming down and feeding you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Every now and then."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not on a regular basis?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Every day or so they bring enough to subsist on."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As she's talking, I'm going to see if there's any sort of arcana or magical incantation on her, or any sort of possession. Is that something I can check for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you have the Detect Magic spell?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I just do an arcana check, or is that not--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I mean, what are you--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Arcana's more inspecting a close area to see if there is the nature of an arcane enchantment or something on it, you don't actually like sense it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right. Then I do nothing. I sing a little song.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can't detect magic?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can dispel magic.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Try it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, because that's a spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's a spell. It's a 3rd-level spell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's fine. Let's leave her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I can do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why is she not dead? Why is she not undead?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They were going to feed her to something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, they were going to eat her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's feed her to Trinket and go on.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're not much, but I have rations and a waterskin. I toss them through the bars of her cell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She grabs them as soon as they come through the cell and grasps them to herself.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll be back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're very kind."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do you know if anyone else is in the dungeon down here with you?

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hide in the corner. Stay quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you please let me out?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, you're fucking staying in that cell, and if things go bad upstairs it won't matter if you're in there or not.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If you please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There are things upstairs that we can't protect you from that we are going to deal with first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And there are creatures on the road and in the woods and quite frankly you're safer right now. If we do what we have come here to do, we will come back for you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is war outside right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't you worry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If there is war, then that's the time to leave, when there is distraction."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you raise a blade? Can you fight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can run. I made it up here north, didn't I? I've lived in these lands for quite some time, "I know how to survive."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can come back for her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Please. Please don't leave me. I don't know what's going on."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is awful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it? Leave her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Vax, you're the only one who can pick the lock. We don't have keys. I'm assuming she's locked in there, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can check the cell door.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's leave her. Ma'am, you must believe me when we say you are much safer here than above.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Her fate is intertwined with our own. If she leaves, she has a very good chance of being killed. If we go forward and succeed, we come back and she lives. If we go forward and she dies, she's where she is. This is the best place for her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "At least take the fate into my own hands. I don't mean any wrong here, but I have no reason to "really trust you, either. How can I show my trust, how can I--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can be quiet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I can be quiet. Do not leave me here to waste and die. What if you don't succeed? What if "you fall in whatever folly you're making away into this castle for and I waste away down here myself? "Please."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've just given you food and water. We'll be back within 24 hours. Come on. We're going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
